alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Lafayette; Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Lafayette, northern Yalobusha, southeastern Coahoma, Tallahatchie, southern Quitman and southern Panola Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 708 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Batesville to near Tutwiler. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Batesville, Water Valley, Charleston, George Payne State Park, Holly Springs National Forest, Tutwiler, Marks, Lambert, Crowder, Webb, Sumner, Pope, Enid, Paynes, Vance, Springdale, Curtis Station, Burgess and Scobey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coahoma; Lafayette; Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha
